Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.name: vertices
Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.abstract: The H3 hexagon vertices coordinates of the turbulence tile area.

Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.name: tile
Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.abstract: A tile representation for which the turbulence is tracked.

Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.name: alt
Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.abstract: An altitude based on SkyPath tile altitude. where 1 is 1000 feet. If tile.alt is 38, then alt is 38,000..<39,000 feet.

Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.name: ts
Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.abstract: A UNIX timestamp of when the report has been generated.

Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.name: trend
Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.abstract: A turbulence severity trend if available and based on the previous data cached.

Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.name: distanceTo
Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.abstract: Distance from current location to the nearest coordinate of vertices.

Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.name: timeTo
Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.abstract: Time to pass distanceTo based on the current speed.

Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.name: timeToPass
Structs/TurbulenceItem.html#/s:10SkyPath.abstract: Time to pass the diameter of the vertices based on the current speed.

Structs/Tile.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK4TileV5.name: h3Hex
Structs/Tile.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK4TileV5.abstract: H3 hex index with H3 resolution 5.

Structs/Tile.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK4TileV3.name: alt
Structs/Tile.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK4TileV3.abstract: A SkyPath tile altitude, where 1 is 1000 feet, so if alt is 38 it stands for 38,000..<39,000 feet range.

Structs/Tile.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK4TileV3.name: key
Structs/Tile.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK4TileV3.abstract: A key in the format h3Hex which uniquely identifies this tile in a world. Example: 852aaa37fffffff-38.

Structs/Tile.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK4TileV1.name: keyByCoord
Structs/Tile.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK4TileV1.abstract: A key using an H3 index only. Example: 852aaa37fffffff.

Structs/Tile.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK4TileV1.name: altMetersRange
Structs/Tile.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK4TileV1.abstract: An altitude range of this tile in meters if alt is not nil, otherwise the range is invalid.

Structs/Tile.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK4TileV5.name: init(h3Hex:alt:)
Structs/Tile.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK4TileV5.abstract: Creates a Tile using an H3 hex index and optional altitude.

Structs/Tile.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK4TileV7.name: init(h3Index:alt:)
Structs/Tile.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK4TileV7.abstract: Creates a Tile using an H3 index and optional altitude.

Structs/Tile.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK4TileV3.name: init(key:)
Structs/Tile.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK4TileV3.abstract: Creates a Tile using a Tile.key value. It is a block that is identified by H3 index and altitude.

Structs/Tile.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK4TileV5.name: init(coord:alt:)
Structs/Tile.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK4TileV5.abstract: Creates a Tile using a coordinate that is translated to the corresponding H3 index, and an optional altitude block.

Structs/NowcastItem.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK.name: forecastH
Structs/NowcastItem.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK.abstract: A forecast hours for which this nowcast data was generated.

Structs/NowcastItem.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK.name: ts
Structs/NowcastItem.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK.abstract: A forecast timestamp for which this nowcast data was generated.

Structs/NowcastItem.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK.name: tile
Structs/NowcastItem.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK.abstract: A tile representation for this nowcast data.

Structs/NowcastItem.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK.name: vertices
Structs/NowcastItem.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK.abstract: The H3 hexagon vertices coordinates of the nowcast tile area.

Structs/LiveFlight.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: acType
Structs/LiveFlight.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: The aircraft type. Typically it is an ICAO code.

Structs/LiveFlight.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: ts
Structs/LiveFlight.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: A UNIX timestamp of when the live flight was reported.

Structs/LiveFlight.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: tile
Structs/LiveFlight.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: A tile representation of the flight’s location.

Structs/Flight.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Flig.name: fnum
Structs/Flight.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Flig.abstract: Flight number is a combination of the airline’s ICAO code and 1-4 digit number.

Structs/Flight.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Flig.name: fnumManual
Structs/Flight.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Flig.abstract: SDK will send a current position when in the air that can be visible on the map.

Structs/Flight.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Flig.name: isTempFlight
Structs/Flight.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Flig.abstract: When running in the air without a flight set, the SDK can use a temporary flight to keep tracking data until a real flight is set.

Structs/Flight.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Flig.name: init(dep:dest:fnum:fnumManual:)
Structs/Flight.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Flig.abstract: Create a Flight object to associate tracked data with.

Structs/DataTypeOptions.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: turbulence
Structs/DataTypeOptions.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: Turbulence data that can be queried by SkyPath.turbulence(with:) using TurbulenceQuery to receive TurbulenceItem.

Structs/DataTypeOptions.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: turbulencePolygons
Structs/DataTypeOptions.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: Turbulence polygons that can be queried by SkyPath.turbulencePolygons(with:) using TurbulencePolygonsQuery.

Structs/DataTypeOptions.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: liveFlights
Structs/DataTypeOptions.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: Live flights with the SkyPath app or SDK running.

Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.name: types
Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.abstract: Set it if you need more than just turbulence data.

Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.name: viewportTypes
Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.abstract: It controls what data will be fetched inside the viewport if set.

Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.name: sevs
Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.abstract: By default, all severities of turbulence will be fetched.

Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.name: polygon
Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.abstract: Polygon is a geo-fence area to fetch data inside only.

Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.name: viewport
Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.abstract: A viewport is a polygon of a visible map area in the app to fetch the right data when it’s needed.

Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.name: globalEnabled
Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.abstract: If true turbulence polygons will be fetched worldwide, otherwise, if polygon is set - only inside the polygon.

Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.name: globalTurbulencePolygonsUpToEnabled
Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.abstract: A planet-wide aggregated turbulence area polygons as a GeoJSON string.

Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.name: altRange
Structs/DataQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK9D.abstract: An altitude range to query. Supported only in specific data types.

Structs/AlertResult.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK.name: type
Structs/AlertResult.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK.abstract: A type of search applied to find turbulence items.

Structs/AlertResult.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK.name: tiles
Structs/AlertResult.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK.abstract: Tiles that were processed to find turbulence items.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: minSev
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Min severity level of turbulence to alert.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: sevs
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Severity levels of turbulence. Will use only turbulence with these severities if set.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: timeFrame
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Time frame from now in which search for turbulence. distance will be ignored.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: altRange
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Altitude lower and upper bounds of the range. Should be round to a thousand feet.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: switchToBeamOnDistanceFromRoute
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: If the aircraft is far from this value from the nearest coordinate of a route (if set), then switch to beam mode searching alerts.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: excludeOwnTimeSpan
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Do not alert on your own recorded turbulence for the last time span.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: route
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Coordinates of the route line. widthAround will be used for a route corridor.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: widthAround
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Distance from the route line coordinates to search for alerts.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: polygon
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Polygon coordinates to get turbulence alerts inside it only.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: tiles
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Array of tile keys. Use it to query turbulence in specific tiles.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: dataHistoryTime
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: History time of queried data. When it’s nil the SkyPath.dataHistoryTime value is used.

Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: usePolygonsEnabled
Structs/AlertQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: By default it’s false and only route corridor and viewport low-resolution H3 turbulence reports will be queried.

Structs/Aircraft.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK8Ai.name: id
Structs/Aircraft.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK8Ai.abstract: The id of the object, typically the ICAO code, and equals icao.

Structs/TurbulenceResultOptions.html#/s:.name: geoJSONData
Structs/TurbulenceResultOptions.html#/s:.abstract: A valid GeoJSON string as Data according to https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7946 .

Structs/TurbulenceResult.html#/s:10SkyPa.name: tiles
Structs/TurbulenceResult.html#/s:10SkyPa.abstract: A set of tiles as H3 indexes.

Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: type
Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: Type of the turbulence data whether it’s from the server or own tracked. See TurbulenceResultType for more details.

Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: altRange
Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: An altitude range to query. Should be round to a thousand feet.

Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: aggregate
Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: Aggregate turbulence by the tile to have only one most severe turbulence per tile.

Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: tiles
Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: Array of a tile key generated by Tile.key or Tile.keyByCoord. Use it to query turbulence in the specific tiles.

Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: route
Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: A route line coordinates. Should be used in conjunction with widthAround.

Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: widthAround
Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: A distance around route to build a route corridor.

Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: polygon
Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: Polygon is a geo-fence area to fetch data inside only.

Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: usePolygonsEnabled
Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: By default it’s false and only route corridor and viewport low-resolution H3 turbulence reports will be queried.

Structs/TurbulencePolygonsResultOptions..name: geoJSONData
Structs/TurbulencePolygonsResultOptions..abstract: A valid GeoJSON string as Data according to https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7946 .

Structs/TurbulencePolygonsResult.html#/s.name: tiles
Structs/TurbulencePolygonsResult.html#/s.abstract: A set of tiles as H3 indexes.

Structs/TurbulencePolygonsQuery.html#/s:.name: altRange
Structs/TurbulencePolygonsQuery.html#/s:.abstract: An altitude range to query. Should be round to a thousand feet.

Structs/TurbulencePolygonsQuery.html#/s:.name: polygon
Structs/TurbulencePolygonsQuery.html#/s:.abstract: Polygon is a geo-fence area to fetch data inside only.

Structs/NowcastResultOptions.html#/s:10S.name: geoJSONData
Structs/NowcastResultOptions.html#/s:10S.abstract: A valid GeoJSON string as Data according to https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7946 .

Structs/NowcastQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSD.name: aggregate
Structs/NowcastQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSD.abstract: Aggregate data by the tile to have only one most severe per tile.

Structs/NowcastQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSD.name: tiles
Structs/NowcastQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSD.abstract: Set of tile keys generated by Tile.key or Tile.keyByCoord.

Structs/NowcastQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSD.name: excludeTiles
Structs/NowcastQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSD.abstract: Set of tile keys generated by Tile.key or Tile.keyByCoord.

Structs/NowcastQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSD.name: polygon
Structs/NowcastQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSD.abstract: Polygon is a geo-fence area to fetch data inside only.

Structs/NowcastQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSD.name: viewport
Structs/NowcastQuery.html#/s:10SkyPathSD.abstract: Viewport is a geo-fence area to fetch data inside only.

Structs/LiveFlightResultOptions.html#/s:.name: geoJSONData
Structs/LiveFlightResultOptions.html#/s:.abstract: A valid GeoJSON string as Data according to https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7946 .

Structs/LiveFlightQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: altRange
Structs/LiveFlightQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: An altitude range to query. Should be round to a thousand feet.

Structs/LiveFlightQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: resultOptions
Structs/LiveFlightQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: How to provide queried data. The default is items.

Structs/LiveFlightQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: polygon
Structs/LiveFlightQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: Polygon is a geo-fence area to fetch data inside only.

Structs/LiveFlightQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.name: predict
Structs/LiveFlightQuery.html#/s:10SkyPat.abstract: Live flights are fetched periodically from the server, typically every minute, so the position could be outdated.

Structs/LiveFlightQuery.html.name: LiveFlightQuery
Structs/LiveFlightQuery.html.abstract: Use LiveFlightQuery to get filtered data as an array of LiveFlight objects or a GeoJSON string.

Structs/LiveFlightResult.html.name: LiveFlightResult
Structs/LiveFlightResult.html.abstract: A result of query live flights using LiveFlightQuery.

Structs/LiveFlightResultOptions.html.name: LiveFlightResultOptions
Structs/LiveFlightResultOptions.html.abstract: Controls how to receive a queried items result.

Structs/NowcastQuery.html.name: NowcastQuery
Structs/NowcastQuery.html.abstract: Use NowcastQuery to get filtered data as an array of NowcastItem objects or a GeoJSON string.

Structs/NowcastResultOptions.html.name: NowcastResultOptions
Structs/NowcastResultOptions.html.abstract: Controls how to receive a queried data result using NowcastQuery.

Structs/TurbulencePolygonsQuery.html.name: TurbulencePolygonsQuery
Structs/TurbulencePolygonsQuery.html.abstract: Use TurbulencePolygonsQuery to get filtered data as a GeoJSON string.

Structs/TurbulencePolygonsResult.html.name: TurbulencePolygonsResult
Structs/TurbulencePolygonsResult.html.abstract: A result of query turbulence polygons using TurbulencePolygonsQuery.

Structs/TurbulencePolygonsResultOptions..name: TurbulencePolygonsResultOptions
Structs/TurbulencePolygonsResultOptions..abstract: Controls how to receive a queried turbulence result using TurbulencePolygonsQuery.

Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html.name: TurbulenceQuery
Structs/TurbulenceQuery.html.abstract: Use TurbulenceQuery to get filtered data as an array of TurbulenceItem objects or a GeoJSON string.

Structs/TurbulenceResultOptions.html.name: TurbulenceResultOptions
Structs/TurbulenceResultOptions.html.abstract: Controls how to receive a queried turbulence result using TurbulenceQuery.

Structs/AlertResult.html.name: AlertResult
Structs/AlertResult.html.abstract: Result object with found alerts based on AlertQuery configuration.

Structs/DataQuery.html.name: DataQuery
Structs/DataQuery.html.abstract: At first request, the whole data according to SkyPath.dataQuery is fetched.

Structs/DataTypeOptions.html.name: DataTypeOptions
Structs/DataTypeOptions.html.abstract: SkyPath data types available to be fetched from the server.

Structs/InjectedLocation.html.name: InjectedLocation
Structs/InjectedLocation.html.abstract: External injected location for SDK to use when the device’s location is not available.

Structs/Tile.html.name: Tile
Structs/Tile.html.abstract: The Tile is a representation of a turbulence report’s H3 index area within a corresponding altitude box.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: didUpdateRecordingStatus(to:)
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: Called after SkyPath.start() when SDK verified the key with the server and started recording and fetching data.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: didReceiveNewTurbulenceData(areaType:)
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: SDK automatically fetches data periodically when online to keep data as fresh as possible.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: didReceiveNewNowcast()
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: SDK automatically fetches data periodically when online.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: detectedTurbulence(_:)
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: Notifies when a new turbulence event is detected.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: didReceiveNewTurbulencePolygons()
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: When a global turbulence polygons data type is enabled,

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: didReceiveNewLiveFlightData()
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: When received new live flight data in the route corridor or viewport.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: didReceiveAlert(_:)
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: Turbulence alert is a warning when there are some turbulence reports ahead based on AlertQuery parameters.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: serverReachabilityUpdated(to:)
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: By default, the SkyPath server domain is used to communicate with the server.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: didChangeDevicePosition(_:horizontal:)
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: The device sensors are analyzed to determine the turbulence events, so the fixed device position (angle) is required for a correct recording.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: didUpdateLowPowerMode(_:)
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: When the flight is started by SkyPath.startFlight(_:) the high accuracy location tracking is enabled in both background and foreground.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.name: didUpdateFetchingStatus(to:areaType:dataType:)
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: Data is auto-fetched periodically from the server. The period can be configured by SkyPath.dataUpdateFrequency.

Protocols.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK7SPErrorP.name: SPError
Protocols.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK7SPErrorP.abstract: A base error protocol for SDK-generated errors.

Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html.name: SkyPathDelegate
Protocols/SkyPathDelegate.html.abstract: Delegate methods to receive events from the SDK.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa10SkyPathSDKS.name: smoothed(iterations:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa10SkyPathSDKS.abstract: Smooth the polygon using the Ramer–Douglas–Peucker algorithm.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa10SkyPathSDKA.name: geoJSON()
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa10SkyPathSDKA.abstract: Converts the array of LiveFlight to a valid GeoJSON that can be visualized on the map.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa10SkyPathSDKA.name: geoJSON()
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa10SkyPathSDKA.abstract: Converts the array of NowcastItem to a valid GeoJSON that can be visualized on the map.

Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa10SkyPathSDKA.name: geoJSON(withType:)
Extensions/Array.html#/s:Sa10SkyPathSDKA.abstract: Converts the array of TurbulenceItem to a valid GeoJSON that can be visualized on the map.

Enums/TurbulenceTrend.html#/s:10SkyPathS.name: better
Enums/TurbulenceTrend.html#/s:10SkyPathS.abstract: The new aggregated max severity is lower.

Enums/TurbulenceTrend.html#/s:10SkyPathS.name: worse
Enums/TurbulenceTrend.html#/s:10SkyPathS.abstract: The new aggregated max severity is higher.

Enums/TurbulenceSeverity.html#/s:10SkyPa.name: none
Enums/TurbulenceSeverity.html#/s:10SkyPa.abstract: Smooth. The device didn’t experience any turbulence.

Enums/TurbulenceSeverity.html#/s:10SkyPa.name: colorOpacity
Enums/TurbulenceSeverity.html#/s:10SkyPa.abstract: The default color opacity of the level.

Enums/TurbulenceSeverity.html#/s:10SkyPa.name: colorWithOpacity
Enums/TurbulenceSeverity.html#/s:10SkyPa.abstract: The default severity color with applied opacity.

Enums/NowcastSeverity.html#/s:10SkyPathS.name: colorOpacity
Enums/NowcastSeverity.html#/s:10SkyPathS.abstract: The default color opacity of the level.

Enums/NowcastSeverity.html#/s:10SkyPathS.name: colorWithOpacity
Enums/NowcastSeverity.html#/s:10SkyPathS.abstract: The default severity color with applied opacity.

Enums/StartError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10S.name: envInvalid
Enums/StartError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10S.abstract: The environment is invalid. Check the env parameter.

Enums/StartError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10S.name: userIdOrAirlineInvalid
Enums/StartError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10S.abstract: The user id or an airline is empty or invalid.

Enums/StartError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10S.name: unauthorized(message:)
Enums/StartError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10S.abstract: The provided API key or an airline is not authorized to use.

Enums/StartError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10S.name: userLocked(message:)
Enums/StartError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10S.abstract: User is locked for a specific time due to many failed authentication attempts.

Enums/QueryError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10Q.name: altRangeNotRoundToThousandFeet
Enums/QueryError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10Q.abstract: Altitude range should be rounded to thousand feet.

Enums/GeneralError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: internetConnectionAppearsOffline
Enums/GeneralError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: The Internet connection appears to be offline.

Enums/GeneralError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: tooManyRequests
Enums/GeneralError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: When trying to call the same endpoint too many times and requests are restricted for some time.

Enums/GeneralError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: upgradeRequired(message:)
Enums/GeneralError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: SDK version is not supported, the upgrade is required.

Enums/GeneralError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: noLocation
Enums/GeneralError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: No location access, for example when no location permission has been granted.

Enums/GeneralError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: disabled(message:)
Enums/GeneralError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: The data type has not been set in the DataQuery.types or the feature is disabled for this airline.

Enums/GeneralError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: noError
Enums/GeneralError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Operation has been canceled or no error is available.

Enums/AlertError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10A.name: invalidCoordinates
Enums/AlertError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10A.abstract: Passed coordinates array is invalid, and should contain 2 or more items.

Enums/AlertError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10A.name: invalidPolygon
Enums/AlertError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10A.abstract: Passed polygon array is invalid, and should contain 3 or more items.

Enums/AlertError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10A.name: altRangeNotRoundToThousandFeet
Enums/AlertError.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK10A.abstract: Altitude range should be rounded to thousand feet. For example, 38000-40000 feet is correct, and 38000-40100 or 38100-40000 is wrong.

Enums/Environment.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK11.name: dev(serverUrl:)
Enums/Environment.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK11.abstract: The development server environment. By default it is https://dev-api.skypath.io.

Enums/Environment.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK11.name: staging(serverUrl:)
Enums/Environment.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK11.abstract: The staging server environment. By default it is https://staging-api.skypath.io.

Enums/Environment.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK11.name: prod(serverUrl:)
Enums/Environment.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK11.abstract: The production server environment. By default it is https://api.skypath.io.

Enums/DataUpdateFrequency.html#/s:10SkyP.name: none
Enums/DataUpdateFrequency.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: No data will be fetched from the server.

Enums/DataUpdateFrequency.html#/s:10SkyP.name: minimal
Enums/DataUpdateFrequency.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: New data from the server will be fetched every 1 minute.

Enums/DataUpdateFrequency.html#/s:10SkyP.name: medium
Enums/DataUpdateFrequency.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: New data from the server will be fetched every 1 minute.

Enums/DataUpdateFrequency.html#/s:10SkyP.name: fast
Enums/DataUpdateFrequency.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: New data from the server will be fetched every 1 minute. This one is used by default.

Enums/DataHistoryTime.html#/s:10SkyPathS.name: init(mins:)
Enums/DataHistoryTime.html#/s:10SkyPathS.abstract: Only predefined values are supported. When there is no such case for provided minutes value, the default twoHours will be used.

Enums/DataAreaType.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: global
Enums/DataAreaType.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: The global data is turbulence polygons. It gives a high-level view when no detailed data is needed.

Enums/DataAreaType.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: viewport
Enums/DataAreaType.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: The visible map viewport is configured by SkyPath.dataQuery.viewport.

Enums/DataAreaType.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: all
Enums/DataAreaType.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Locally cached data that merges all area types. Provided once after start.

Enums/AlertResultType.html#/s:10SkyPathS.name: none
Enums/AlertResultType.html#/s:10SkyPathS.abstract: When no alert is found. Typically you will not see it.

Enums/AlertResultType.html#/s:10SkyPathS.name: coordinates
Enums/AlertResultType.html#/s:10SkyPathS.abstract: When AlertQuery.route is provided and alerts are found in the route corridor using AlertQuery.widthAround.

Enums/AlertResultType.html#/s:10SkyPathS.name: polygon
Enums/AlertResultType.html#/s:10SkyPathS.abstract: When AlertQuery.polygon is provided and alerts are found inside it.

Enums/AlertResultType.html#/s:10SkyPathS.name: tiles
Enums/AlertResultType.html#/s:10SkyPathS.abstract: When AlertQuery.tiles is provided to search alerts inside specific tiles only.

Enums/TurbulenceResultType.html#/s:10Sky.name: serverExcludeOwn(timeSpan:)
Enums/TurbulenceResultType.html#/s:10Sky.abstract: Turbulence data received from the server taking into account own tracked data in both cases when it was already sent or not yet.

Enums/TurbulenceResultType.html#/s:10Sky.name: own(timeSpan:)
Enums/TurbulenceResultType.html#/s:10Sky.abstract: Own data tracked on the current device.

Enums/NowcastHours.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: title
Enums/NowcastHours.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: The following titles are used for corresponding cases: Now, +1h, +2h, +3h, +4h, +5h, +6h.

Enums/NowcastHours.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: tsRange(since:)
Enums/NowcastHours.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: A time range this case represents. Nowcast is an hourly forecast, so each case represent an hour range. Unix timestamps.

Enums/LoggingLevel.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: verbose
Enums/LoggingLevel.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: All messages will be printed into console output.

Enums/LoggingLevel.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: debug
Enums/LoggingLevel.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Includes debug level messages and helpful data to investigate possible issues.

Enums/LoggingLevel.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: info
Enums/LoggingLevel.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Includes warn level messages and informational messages that can be ignored.

Enums/LoggingLevel.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: warn
Enums/LoggingLevel.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Includes error level messages and not critical warning information.

Enums/LoggingLevel.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.name: error
Enums/LoggingLevel.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK1.abstract: Only error messages that most likely need action or at least attention. Min required level.

Enums/LoggingLevel.html.name: LoggingLevel
Enums/LoggingLevel.html.abstract: The logs console output data amount level where error is a minimum amount and verbose is a maximum.

Enums/TurbulenceResultType.html.name: TurbulenceResultType
Enums/TurbulenceResultType.html.abstract: Fetched from the server and own tracked data are stored locally on the device up to the maximum supported time.

Enums/AlertResultType.html.name: AlertResultType
Enums/AlertResultType.html.abstract: Based on AlertQuery and DataQuery configuration the alerts can be searched in different ways.

Enums/DataAreaType.html.name: DataAreaType
Enums/DataAreaType.html.abstract: The data fetch from the server is separated by area types like route corridor, visible map viewport, and global (for some types only).

Enums/DataHistoryTime.html.name: DataHistoryTime
Enums/DataHistoryTime.html.abstract: When started, SDK fetches initial data from time back in time and then receives only updates since the last update.

Enums/DataUpdateFrequency.html.name: DataUpdateFrequency
Enums/DataUpdateFrequency.html.abstract: It controls time intervals to fetch data for global turbulence polygons, route polygons, viewport, and other data.

Enums/Environment.html.name: Environment
Enums/Environment.html.abstract: Server environment used by SDK internal API routing.

Enums/AlertError.html.name: AlertError
Enums/AlertError.html.abstract: Errors returned when making a query for alerts via SkyPath.alerts(with:).

Enums/QueryError.html.name: QueryError
Enums/QueryError.html.abstract: Errors returned when making a data query.

Enums/StartError.html.name: StartError
Enums/StartError.html.abstract: Errors returned in a completion block when starting the SDK by SkyPath.start().

Enums/NowcastSeverity.html.name: NowcastSeverity
Enums/NowcastSeverity.html.abstract: A severity level of a nowcast data.

Enums/TurbulenceSeverity.html.name: TurbulenceSeverity
Enums/TurbulenceSeverity.html.abstract: A severity level of a turbulence report.

Enums/TurbulenceTrend.html.name: TurbulenceTrend
Enums/TurbulenceTrend.html.abstract: Determined when new data is received by comparing it to the previously locally stored data.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: shared
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Shared instance that should be used for all operations.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: delegate
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Implement SkyPathDelegate methods to get notified when new data has been received from the server.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: start(apiKey:airline:userId:env:completion:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Start the SDK. It will not track and provide data until started.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: isStarted
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Check if SDK has been started already or not. Can be used before calling start().

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: stop()
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Stops all SDK activities including communication with the server and turbulence detection.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: dataQuery
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Configures what, how, and when data should be fetched from the server.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: dataUpdateFrequency
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Control the update data from the server frequency to reduce network traffic. Set none to not fetch any data temporarily.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: dataHistoryTime
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: It determines the data history to be fetched from the server.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: dataUpdatedAt
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Last date when successfully received new data from the server.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: fetchData(refresh:types:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Data is automatically fetched from the server by SDK out of the box, as well on changing data in dataQuery or dataUpdateFrequency.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: fetchingStatus(for:dataType:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Get if specific area data is currently fetching from the server or not.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: turbulence(with:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Get turbulence data using a query in locally cached data without making a server request.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: turbulencePolygons(with:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Get turbulence polygons data using a query in locally cached data without making a server request.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: nowcast(with:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Get nowcast data using a query in locally cached data without making a server request.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: nowcastAvailable(for:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Nowcast data is generated per specific forecast hours described in NowcastHours.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: liveFlights(with:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Get live flights data using a query in locally cached data without making a server request.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: alerts(with:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Get alerts manually when needed.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: startMonitoringAlerts(with:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Automatic monitoring. SDK will check for turbulence on every new location update.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: stopMonitoringAlerts()
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Stop monitoring alerts in an automatic mode.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: isMonitoringAlerts
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Check if auto monitoring has been started or it’s stopped/not started.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: alertedTurbulenceSeverity(_:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Call it when showing turbulence ahead notification to the pilot.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: aircraft
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Set a current aircraft type using supported types from the SDK.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: aircrafts()
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Get all aircraft supported by SkyPath.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: aircraft(byId:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Get an Aircraft by an id (ICAO code). Same as Aircraft(id:).

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: setFlight(_:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Update the current flight details. Flight is saved even across app launches.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: flight
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Current flight if any set by startFlight(_:).

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: setMapLayer(enabled:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Set when toggle SkyPath layer visibility, when showing or hiding the layer on the map.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: allowsBackgroundLocationUpdates
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Background location access is required to track turbulence and show notifications.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: version
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: SDK version.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: env
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Current evironment.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: inPosition
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: If the device is in position.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: isHorizontal
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Data is not recorded when the iPad is horizontal.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: inNoise
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: If there is a noise at the moment like moving the device out of the position.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: logger
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: SDK has an internal logging system to help with debugging and solving issues.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: useCalculatedPressureAltitudeForSelf
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Enables calculated pressure altitude for self.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: inject(location:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Inject an external location for SDK to use in case the device’s location is not available.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: enableSimulation(_:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: In simulation mode, you can pass the simulated location to the SDK via simulateLocation(:) for testing purposes only.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: simulatedLocation(_:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Provide a simulated location for testing only. Should be set to simulation mode by enableSimulation(:).

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: enablePushSimulated(_:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Enable SDK to send turbulence and events to the server.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: simulateTurbulence(sev:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Trigger a turbulence event by using a timer at some time intervals, or randomly during some time.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: simulateBadLocation(_:)
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: Simulate bad location by dropping location updates.

Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.name: simulateBadLocation
Classes/SkyPath.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK0aB0.abstract: If simulate bad location is currently enabled or not.

Classes/TurbulenceClusterer/Options.html.name: maxDistanceNM
Classes/TurbulenceClusterer/Options.html.abstract: When the distance from turbulence to any turbulence in an existing cluster is greater it will be moved to another or a new cluster.

Classes/TurbulenceClusterer/Options.html.name: maxDistanceToNearestNM
Classes/TurbulenceClusterer/Options.html.abstract: When the distance from turbulence to the nearest turbulence in an existing cluster is greater it will be moved to another or a new cluster.

Classes/TurbulenceClusterer.html#/s:10Sk.name: isAlerted(cluster:)
Classes/TurbulenceClusterer.html#/s:10Sk.abstract: Checks if the cluster has turbulence tiles that were already alerted (based on tiles) to not alert again.

Classes/TurbulenceClusterer.html#/s:10Sk.name: alerted(cluster:)
Classes/TurbulenceClusterer.html#/s:10Sk.abstract: Save cluster turbulence as alerted to check by isAlerted(cluster:) to not alert the same turbulence multiple times.

Classes/TurbulenceClusterer.html#/s:10Sk.name: reset()
Classes/TurbulenceClusterer.html#/s:10Sk.abstract: Removes generated and alerted clusters. Should be called when stopped monitoring alerts or stopped the route, or when no need to cluster anymore.

Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.name: center
Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: The calculated center of the cluster is based on all turbulence coordinates in it.

Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.name: severity
Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: The highest turbulence severity that this cluster has.

Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.name: diameterDistance
Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: The diameter of the cluster is based on turbulence coordinates in it.

Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.name: distanceTo
Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: Distance from current location to the nearest coordinate of bbox of turbulence items.

Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.name: timeTo
Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: Time to pass distanceTo based on the current speed.

Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.name: timeToPass
Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: Time to pass diameterDistance based on the current speed.

Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.name: nearestMaxSevTurbulence
Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: The nearest turbulence item from turbulence is based on the tile center.

Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.name: nearestMaxSevCenter
Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html#/s:10SkyP.abstract: The center of the nearest turbulence tile with the highest severity.

Classes/SPLocalNotificationManager.html#.name: checkNotificationSettings(completion:)
Classes/SPLocalNotificationManager.html#.abstract: Check current notifications usage permission. Will be auto-requested if the status is notDetermined.

Classes/SPLocalNotificationManager.html#.name: scheduleNotification(title:body:sound:soundEnabled:contentCategoryIdentifier:timeInterval:identifier:userInfo:)
Classes/SPLocalNotificationManager.html#.abstract: Schedule a local notification to be shown immediately.

Classes/SPLocalNotificationManager.html#.name: scheduleNotification(content:timeInterval:identifier:)
Classes/SPLocalNotificationManager.html#.abstract: Schedule a local notification to be shown immediately.

Classes/Logger.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Logg.name: level
Classes/Logger.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Logg.abstract: The logs console output data amount level. The default is error.

Classes/Logger.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Logg.name: rollingFrequency
Classes/Logger.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Logg.abstract: Frequency for creating a new log file. Older log files will be removed when maximumNumberOfLogFiles will be reached.

Classes/Logger.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Logg.name: maximumNumberOfLogFiles
Classes/Logger.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Logg.abstract: A maximum number of log files stored locally. Each file contains logs per time interval set in rollingFrequency.

Classes/Logger.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Logg.name: exportLogs(notifyOnQueue:completion:)
Classes/Logger.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Logg.abstract: Export logs file to send for investigating.

Classes/Logger.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Logg.name: exportedLogs()
Classes/Logger.html#/s:10SkyPathSDK6Logg.abstract: Export logs file to send for investigating.

Classes/Logger.html.name: Logger
Classes/Logger.html.abstract: An internal logger system. Messages are written into text files stored in the application sandbox directory.

Classes/SPLocalNotificationManager.html.name: SPLocalNotificationManager
Classes/SPLocalNotificationManager.html.abstract: Helper for showing local notifications. For example, a turbulence alert when the app is in the background.

Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html.name: TurbulenceCluster
Classes/TurbulenceCluster.html.abstract: Generated cluster exists until no turbulence can be added to this cluster.

Classes/TurbulenceClusterer.html.name: TurbulenceClusterer
Classes/TurbulenceClusterer.html.abstract: Group TurbulenceItem based on distance. New turbulence will be added to existing clusters or to new clusters.

Classes/SkyPath.html.name: SkyPath
Classes/SkyPath.html.abstract: Use a shared instance SkyPath.shared which is an entry point for work with the SDK.
